::: callout-tip
## Objective

After this session, you should be able to run a simulation, vary its parameters and have a basic understanding of the statistical power, its drivers and what its lack thereof entails. 
:::

## Summary

In this session, we focus on statistical power and the impact of lack thereof. 

First, we study some of its drivers by expanding our simple simulations. We vary parameters values (sample size, effect size, proportion of treated) and look at their impact on statistical power. Then, we present the related concept of exaggeration and discuss how it may interact with causal identification strategies.

### Session Outline

1.  Summary from last week
1.  R coding on your own: varying parameters
1.  A primer on exaggeration
1.  Causal exaggeration
1.  Exercise: implementing a complex simulation
